episodeTitle: Five Namis? Nami Strikes Back with Mirages!
episodeTitleJapanese: 五人のナミ？反撃は蜃気楼とともに！
episodeTitleRomanized: Gonin no Nami? Hangeki wa shinkirō to tomo ni!
description: Nami continues her intense battle against CP9's Kalifa, discovering that water can counter Kalifa's soap-based Devil Fruit abilities. With help from Chopper's Monster Point rampage, Nami uses her Perfect Clima-Tact to create five mirage versions of herself. Meanwhile, Luffy continues his fierce battle with Rob Lucci, and Spandam drags Robin toward the Gates of Justice.

events.title: Nami vs Kalifa Battle Continues
events.description: Nami's battle with CP9 agent Kalifa intensifies. Kalifa has weakened Nami using her Awa Awa no Mi Devil Fruit powers, covering Nami in soap bubbles that drain her strength and make her body slippery.
events.significance: This battle showcases Nami's growth as a fighter and her intelligence in discovering her opponent's weakness. It's also significant as one of the few major female vs female fights in One Piece.

quotes.text: You're already too weak to stand. Just give up!
quotes.speaker: Kalifa
quotes.context: Kalifa taunting Nami about her weakened state

events.title: Chopper's Monster Point Rampage
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper, in his uncontrollable Monster Point form, crashes through the Tower of Justice rooms, bursting through walls. His rampage inadvertently passes through the room where Nami is fighting Kalifa, causing chaos and disruption.
events.significance: Chopper's Monster Point appearance becomes crucial to Nami's victory, as it creates the distraction and situation that allows Nami to discover Kalifa's weakness. Shows how the Straw Hats' battles interconnect at Enies Lobby.

events.title: Water Weakens Kalifa's Soap Powers
events.description: When Chopper crashes through, water from a nearby source splashes onto Nami's soap-covered leg. Nami immediately notices that the water washes away the weakening soap bubbles, restoring her leg to normal. She realizes that water is the natural weakness of Kalifa's Awa Awa no Mi powers.
events.significance: This discovery is the turning point in Nami's battle. It demonstrates Nami's intelligence and observational skills in combat, allowing her to formulate a strategy to defeat a physically superior opponent.

quotes.text: Water! That's it! Water washes away the soap!
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: Nami Uses Rain Tempo to Restore Herself
events.description: Using her Perfect Clima-Tact, Nami creates a Rain Tempo, generating rain clouds that wash the soap bubbles off her body. The water completely neutralizes Kalifa's weakening effects, restoring Nami to her full strength.
events.significance: Shows Nami's strategic thinking in using her weather-based abilities to counter Devil Fruit powers. This moment represents her growth as a tactician who can adapt her toolkit to overcome different opponents.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami using rain to wash away the soap

events.title: Nami Debuts Cool Charge
events.description: Nami uses a new technique called Cool Charge, creating a Cool Ball on the end of her Perfect Clima-Tact. This sets up her upgraded version of Mirage Tempo by manipulating the temperature and creating atmospheric conditions for mirages.
events.significance: First appearance of Cool Charge, which becomes a key component of Nami's advanced weather techniques. Shows her weapon upgrades from Usopp are more sophisticated than her original Clima-Tact.

events.title: Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana Debut
events.description: Nami unveils her most spectacular technique yet - Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana. Using temperature manipulation, she creates five visual illusions of herself with different body types: a tall skinny version, a short child version, a fat version, a muscular version, and her normal form. All move in perfect unison, making it impossible to tell which is real.
events.significance: This is one of Nami's most iconic techniques, demonstrating her mastery over meteorological phenomena. The technique completely confounds Kalifa and showcases Nami's creativity in combat. Named after the complex mirage phenomenon 'Fata Morgana'.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami revealing her five mirage duplicates

quotes.text: Five Namis?! Which one is real?!
quotes.speaker: Kalifa

events.title: Kalifa Uses Shinaru Shigan 'Whip'
events.description: Kalifa demonstrates a variation of the Rokushiki technique Shigan, called Shinaru Shigan 'Whip'. Instead of a straight finger thrust, she uses a flexible, whip-like motion to extend her finger strike's range and make it curve.
events.significance: Shows Kalifa's mastery of Rokushiki techniques and her ability to adapt them to her fighting style. Demonstrates CP9's advanced martial arts capabilities.

events.title: Zoro and Sogeking vs Kaku and Jabra
events.description: Roronoa Zoro and Sogeking (Usopp) team up against CP9's Kaku and Jabra. The two CP9 agents initially work together despite their rivalry, attempting to overwhelm the Straw Hats before the Buster Call arrives.
events.significance: Sets up the tag-team dynamics that will eventually split into individual battles. Shows the CP9 agents' fear of the approaching Buster Call deadline.

events.title: Zoro and Sogeking Use 'Makie'
events.description: When Kaku and Jabra attack simultaneously, Zoro and Sogeking execute a defensive technique called 'Makie' (巻絵) which deflects the attacks. This shows their improvised teamwork despite their contrasting fighting styles.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' ability to work together and adapt to team-based combat situations, even when their individual styles differ greatly.

events.title: Luffy vs Lucci Battle Continues
events.description: Monkey D. Luffy and Rob Lucci continue their intense battle in the Tower of Justice. Lucci, in his leopard hybrid form, demonstrates his overwhelming power and speed. Luffy struggles to land effective hits as Lucci's Rokushiki mastery and Zoan Devil Fruit powers make him a formidable opponent.
events.significance: This is the main event of the Enies Lobby arc - the clash between the Straw Hat captain and CP9's strongest agent. Represents the battle between freedom and the World Government's oppressive control.

quotes.text: I won't let you get to Robin!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

events.title: Lucci Kicks Luffy Away from Door
events.description: Luffy attempts to throw Rob Lucci aside to reach the door that leads toward Robin. However, Lucci counters with a powerful kick, sending Luffy flying away from the door. This demonstrates Lucci's tactical awareness and his role as the final obstacle between Luffy and Robin.
events.significance: Emphasizes the stakes of the battle - Luffy must defeat Lucci to have any chance of reaching Robin before she's taken through the Gates of Justice. Shows Lucci's cold efficiency as a guardian of the World Government's interests.

events.title: Spandam Drags Robin Toward Gates of Justice
events.description: Spandam continues dragging the handcuffed Nico Robin through the Tower of Justice corridors toward the Gates of Justice. Robin tries to reason with him about the Buster Call's danger, but Spandam is obsessed with the promotion he'll receive for delivering her.
events.significance: Creates urgency for the Straw Hats' battles. Every moment they spend fighting CP9, Robin gets closer to being taken away forever. Shows Spandam's selfish ambitions despite the danger to everyone at Enies Lobby.

quotes.text: Once I hand you over, I'll be promoted! Nothing else matters!
quotes.speaker: Spandam

events.title: Spandam Reminds Robin of Luffy's Battle
events.description: Spandam cruelly reminds Robin that Luffy is fighting Rob Lucci and will likely lose. He taunts her about the futility of the Straw Hats' rescue attempt, trying to break her spirit and hope.
events.significance: Shows Spandam's psychological cruelty and his attempts to crush Robin's hope. Contrasts with the genuine bonds of friendship the Straw Hats have shown.

quotes.text: Your captain is fighting Lucci. He doesn't stand a chance!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam taunting Robin about Luffy's chances

events.title: Chimney and Kokoro Navigate Tower
events.description: Chimney, the young girl, and her grandmother Kokoro (along with Gonbe the rabbit) continue navigating through the Tower of Justice's corridors. They witness the various battles and destruction happening throughout the tower.
events.significance: Provides a civilian perspective on the chaos at Enies Lobby. Chimney and Kokoro serve as witnesses to the Straw Hats' determination and will play a role in later events.

quotes.text: Water! That's it! Water washes away the soap!
quotes.speaker: Nami
Nami
quotes.context: Nami revealing her five mirage duplicates

quotes.text: Five Namis?! Which one is real?!
quotes.speaker: Kalifa

quotes.text: I won't let you get to Robin!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Once I hand you over, I'll be promoted! Nothing else matters!
quotes.speaker: Spandam

themes.description: Nami's battle with Kalifa emphasizes that tactical thinking and adaptability can overcome physically superior opponents. Rather than matching Kalifa's CP9 training power-for-power, Nami uses her understanding of weather and keen observation to exploit a fundamental weakness.
themes.symbolism: The five mirages represent Nami's multifaceted approach to combat - she doesn't need to be the strongest if she can be the smartest.
culturalReferences: The technique name 'Fata Morgana' references a complex mirage phenomenon, showing Nami's scientific approach to combat

themes.description: The Nami vs Kalifa fight is one of the most significant female vs female battles in One Piece. Both women demonstrate their unique combat styles and philosophies, with Nami proving that femininity and strength aren't mutually exclusive.
themes.symbolism: Nami's victory over a World Government agent shows that the Straw Hat crew's strength comes from all its members, not just the physical powerhouses.

themes.description: All the battles at Enies Lobby are happening simultaneously, creating a sense of collective struggle. Chopper's Monster Point rampage affects Nami's fight, showing how the crew's fates are intertwined.
themes.symbolism: The Tower of Justice becomes a vertical battlefield where multiple stories unfold at once, representing the complexity of their mission.

themes.description: With Spandam dragging Robin toward the Gates of Justice and the Buster Call approaching, every battle is a race against time. The Straw Hats must win quickly or lose Robin forever.
themes.symbolism: Robin's journey toward the Gates represents time running out, while the battles represent the obstacles that must be overcome quickly.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her growth as both a fighter and a tactician. She doesn't panic when weakened by Kalifa's powers, instead observing her environment and using her meteorological knowledge to turn the tide. The debut of Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana shows how far her combat abilities have evolved since receiving the Perfect Clima-Tact.
keyActions: Discovers water as the weakness of Awa Awa no Mi
Uses Rain Tempo to restore herself
Creates five mirage versions with Fata Morgana
quotes: Water! That's it! Water washes away the soap!

characterSpotlights.development: Kalifa displays her CP9 training and Devil Fruit mastery, initially dominating Nami with her Awa Awa no Mi powers. However, her confidence becomes her weakness as she underestimates Nami's intelligence and adaptability.
keyActions: Uses Awa Awa no Mi to weaken Nami
Struggles to identify the real Nami
quotes: You're already too weak to stand. Just give up!
Five Namis?! Which one is real?!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues his desperate battle against Rob Lucci, showing his unwavering determination to reach Robin despite being outmatched. His struggle represents the ultimate test of his resolve as captain.
keyActions: Battles Rob Lucci in leopard form
Attempts to reach the door to Robin
Refuses to give up despite the odds
quotes: I won't let you get to Robin!

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam's selfish ambitions and cruelty are on full display as he drags Robin toward the Gates of Justice, caring only about his promotion and taking pleasure in taunting her about Luffy's likely defeat.
keyActions: Ignores warnings about the Buster Call
quotes: Once I hand you over, I'll be promoted! Nothing else matters!
Your captain is fighting Lucci. He doesn't stand a chance!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended Chopper's Monster Point rampage sequence, showing more of his destructive path through the Tower of Justice.
The visual effects for Mirage Tempo: Fata Morgana were enhanced in the anime with more detailed animation of the five different Nami forms.
Two animation errors were noted: Luffy's shorts briefly appear blue instead of black, and Nami's leg remains golden-tinted after water restores it to normal in one shot.

trivia.fact: Episode 295 featured the opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa. This opening is notable for not using any footage from actual episodes, instead showing the Straw Hats in an original island scenario.
This episode has no ending theme. Toei Animation stopped airing ending themes from Episode 279 to Episode 1070 to allow for extended opening sequences and longer episode runtime.
Episode 295 aired with a 7.8% viewership rating in Japan, ranking 6th in its time slot, showing continued strong interest in the Enies Lobby arc.

The technique name 'Fata Morgana' is named after a complex form of superior mirage that is seen in a narrow band right above the horizon. It's named after Morgan le Fay, a sorceress from Arthurian legend, believed to create illusory castles.

sources.title: Art of Weather/Perfect Clima-Tact - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Nami vs Kalifa is considered one of the most significant female vs female battles in One Piece, as the series predominantly features male combatants in major fights.

sources.title: Nami vs. Kalifa - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 295 adapts Chapter 410 (pages 6-19) and Chapter 411 (pages 2-16), maintaining a relatively faithful 2-chapter adaptation pace common for the Enies Lobby arc.
Manga artist Boichi created a special one-shot recreation of the Nami vs Kalifa fight in 2022, giving it a more detailed and dramatic visual treatment.

sources.title: Nami vs. Kalifa by Boichi - Fiction Horizon
